question_sentence: A writers strike that began this week is impacting production on late night and scripted TV shows. How long has the union signaled that the work stoppage could last?
evidence: The Writers Guild of America, representing more than 11,000 members, has hinted that the work stoppage could last for many months. The last WGA strike ran for 100 days from 2007 to 2008.

question_sentence: Uber released its annual list of items forgotten by passengers in cars. Which city took the top spot for being the most forgetful?
evidence: Jacksonville, Florida, had the most forgotten items, including phones, wallets, keys, jewelry and headphones, according to Uber’s report. San Antonio, Texas, and Palm Springs, California, took the second and third spots, respectively.

question_sentence: The Met Gala took place this week in New York City, honoring which creative field?
evidence: The event is often referred to as “Fashion’s Biggest Night.” This year, the theme was “In honor of Karl,” a tribute to the late designer Karl Lagerfeld.

question_sentence: What caused a 70-vehicle crash in Illinois this week?
evidence: At least six people were killed Monday when a dust storm in Illinois suddenly made it nearly impossible to see on the short stretch of highway, officials said.

question_sentence: A multi-state salmonella outbreak was recently linked to which cooking ingredient?
evidence: At least 13 people in a dozen states were infected by a salmonella outbreak linked to Gold Medal flour, the CDC said.

question_sentence: A surge of migrants at the US-Mexico border is expected next week when a Trump-era policy expires on May 11. What is the policy called?
evidence: A surge is expected when Title 42 — the Trump-era policy that allowed authorities to quickly turn away certain migrants at the border during the pandemic — comes to an end.

question_sentence: An investigation by the Department of Labor revealed hundreds of underage children were found working at which fast-food restaurant?
evidence: Three McDonald’s franchisees in Kentucky are facing hefty fines for violating child labor laws after children as young as 10 years old were found working late at night — sometimes until 2 a.m.

question_sentence: Which public figure this week announced she will launch a healthy food and beverage company for kids?
evidence: Former First Lady Michelle Obama announced Wednesday that she’s launching a healthy food and beverage company for kids to help combat the “nutrition-related health crisis” in the US.

question_sentence: After six decades in the making, the FDA this week approved the first vaccine for which virus?
evidence: After a 60-year scientific quest, the world has its first vaccine to protect against respiratory syncytial virus, or RSV.

question_sentence: What is the official dish of the coronation of King Charles III?
evidence: The Royal Family has designated a quiche made with spinach, fava beans and tarragon as the event’s official dish. The recipe includes eggs, cream and cheddar cheese, according to the Royal website.

question_sentence: According to new data released by Nielsen this week, Super Bowl 57 is the most-watched ever. It surpassed which previous matchup?
Regulators seized First Republic Bank and sold all of its deposits and most of its assets to which institution?
A jury ruled British singer Ed Sheeran didn't plagiarize which classic 1970s tune when he created his hit song "Thinking Out Loud"?
choices: "Let's Get It On" by Marvin Gaye

question_sentence: The Writers Guild of America, which represents many Hollywood scribes, went on strike this week. They last hit the picket lines in what year?
Which celebrity arrived at the Met Gala this week wearing the full animal suit pictured below?
The Boston Bruins had a stunning exit from the NHL playoffs after setting the regular season record for the most:
The Nation's Report Card is out. For the first time, which subject saw most eighth graders' scores drop in 2022 compared with 2018?
What did a student in South Korea do to a banana that was part of an art installation worth over $100k?
ESPN apologized for airing footage during the broadcast of a game between the Miami Heat and the New York Knicks that showed what?
Legendary Canadian folk singer Gordon Lightfoot died this week at 84. Finish the title of one of his hit songs: The Wreck of the ...
Liz Truss is facing a bill from the government for how much relating to her use of a grace-and-favour country home?
evidence: The former prime minister is contesting the bill for costs incurred at Chevening House in Kent during her tenure as foreign secretary. The costs reportedly include food, wine and missing items, but Truss says the vast majority of the invoice relates to official government business, for which she would not be liable, rather than personal expenses.

question_sentence: How many flights on private jets were made globally last year, according to a new report?
evidence: According to the think-tank report, the global fleet of private jets has more than doubled in the past two decades, hitting 23,133 in mid-2022, and sales are forecast to reach a record high of $34.6bn (£27.6bn) this year. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What is the name of the anthem composed by Andrew Lloyd Webber for the King’s coronation?
evidence: The composer’s coronation anthem will be played publicly for the first time as King Charles III is crowned in Westminster Abbey on Saturday.  According to Lloyd Webber, the monarch requested that the tune be “hummable” and cheerful because “he wants the anthem sung in churches”.

question_sentence: Keir Starmer vowed to be bolder and “go beyond” which former Labour PM on public service reform?
evidence: In a newspaper interview ahead of Thursday’s local elections, Starmer pledged to lead a “bold and reforming Labour government bringing about real change” by overhauling public services including the NHS. The Labour leader also unveiled plans to help first-time home buyers, and a revamp of tuition fees.

question_sentence: Latest analysis by Reporters Without Borders (RSF) found that which country ranks lowest for press freedom?
evidence: The analysis of press freedom in 180 countries and territories put the hermit kingdom in last place on the annual World Press Freedom Index, followed by Vietnam and China. Norway topped the ranking for the seventh year in a row.

question_sentence: A new study tracking more than 210,000 Brits has linked which everyday activity to high blood pressure?
evidence: Scientists at China’s Southern Medical University tracked 212,000 British adults with an average age of 54 over a 12-year period and found that those who chatted on a mobile for 30 minutes a week were 12% more likely to be diagnosed with high blood pressure, while six hours a week raised the risk to 25%. The researchers suggested that exposure to the low levels of radiofrequency energy emitted by phones may raise blood pressure, and spending hours on calls was also linked to worse sleep and higher stress.

question_sentence: Which energy giant has posted record profits of £7.6bn for the first three months of this year?
evidence: The oil and gas company has been accused of a “profiteering bonanza” after making equivalent to £986 per second in the first quarter of 2023, as households struggle with a cost-of-living crisis largely driven by inflated energy bills. BP this week announced profits of £4bn for the same period.

question_sentence: Police Scotland is facing a flood of complaints from officers over a new policy requiring them to do what?
evidence: Belgium’s Brecel claimed a 18-15 victory over four-times winner Selby in the World Snooker Championship final at Sheffield’s Crucible on Monday.

question_sentence: Police Scotland is facing a flood of complaints from officers over a new policy requiring them to do what?
evidence: The Scottish Police Federation, which represents police officers, has reported being “inundated with complaints” over the policy, which the force said was necessary so that staff could wear protective FFP3 masks that require users to be clean-shaven. Four officers are reportedly taking legal action in relation to the rule, due to come into effect on 29 May.

question_sentence: Which actor paid tribute to Karl Lagerfeld by wearing a giant fluffy cat costume to the 2023 Met Gala?
evidence: Leto dressed up as Legerfeld’s famed cat Choupette for the gala in New York on Monday, which was themed on the late fashion designer.
